page.title: 02Strathmiglo - The Town Hall
page.content: Strathmiglo Castle,which was built about 1535,was built so quickly that James V of Scotland nicknamed it 'Cairneyflappit'.It was built in a field to the south east of the village to be near the royal court at Falkland.Its former site,surrounded by a deep square fosse,can still be seen today.'Cairneyflappit' fell into disrepair,and was demolished in 1734 because the people of Strathmiglo obtained the right to its stones,which were used to build the Town Hall. The Town Hall consists of a square tower with an open balustrade.An eight sided spire,twenty-one metres high,is mounted on top of this.On the bottom half of the tower are the arms of Lady Margaret Balfour,daughter of Sir Michael Balfour of Burleigh,who once owned the lands of Strathmiglo.
